subject: javadoc
msgSnippet: I just downloaded jUnit and reading through the documentation.  One of the first things the cookbook talks about is the runTest() method.  But, the javadoc has
messageBody:
I just downloaded jUnit and reading through the documentation. One of
the first things the cookbook talks about is the runTest() method. But,
the javadoc has no mention of it.

It didn't take much investigation to see where the problem was. javadoc
was obviously run in its default mode. For a library (pretty much
anytime you provide javadoc), the -protected flag should be given to
javadoc. Indeed, the only time the -protected flag should not be used
is for internal development documentation; the -private flag is used
instead.

OK. I found a problem. I know its fix. Now who do I tell? The README
doesn't tell me. I only stumbled across this mailing list.

So, if you read this message, and you can do something about the javadoc
in the distribution and on the web site www.junit.org, then I guess I
have been effective. To all others, I hope I have provided enough
information so you can fix your own installations.
